summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Michael Kearins by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding his appearance and production of documents on August 26, 2019. The subpoena demands all materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and all materials related to the destruction of records at the Metropolitan Correctional Center after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Michael Kearins
persons.context: The individual commanded to appear before the grand jury and produce documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and record destruction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and accused sex trafficker; the subpoena demands all materials relating to him.

connections.description: Kearins is subpoenaed to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating he is a person of interest in the investigation into Epstein.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued the subpoena commanding Kearins to appear and produce documents.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Michael Kearins is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Michael Kearins on August 20, 2019, demanding his appearance on August 26, 2019.
The subpoena demands all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein from Kearins.
The subpoena also demands all materials related to the destruction of records at the Metropolitan Correctional Center after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The document indicates an active investigation into both Epstein's activities and the circumstances surrounding his death and potential evidence destruction.
The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman for the Southern District of New York.
